mortality.note: Death toll includes massacre victims (Deir Yassin, etc.) and war-related civilian deaths. Primary metric is displacement: 700,000-750,000 Palestinians fled or were expelled. Over 400 villages destroyed. Mortality figures debated; displacement figures well-documented.

analysis.pattern_note: Mass displacement during 1948 Arab-Israeli War. Plan Dalet documented military operations to clear Arab villages. 750,000 Palestinians became refugees. Over 400 villages destroyed or depopulated. Deir Yassin massacre became symbol of violence. Israel's 'Absentee Property Law' (1950) legalized seizure of refugee property. Term 'Nakba' (catastrophe) coined by Syrian historian Constantine Zurayk in 1948. Event remains central to Palestinian identity and Israeli-Palestinian conflict.
